headline: Phillips 66 director criticizes activist investor Elliott amid proxy battle
summary: Elliott, which earlier this year disclosed a stake of more than $2.5 billion in Phillips 66, has been pushing for operational changes and a board overhaul at the energy company.  In fact, Pease was appointed as a director on the refiner's board in February 2024 after it reached an agreement with the activist investor.  In a letter to shareholders, Pease said Elliott was a "highly distracted shareholder".

headline: A Letter From Independent Director Bob Pease to Phillips 66 Shareholders
summary: HOUSTON, March 28, 2025--Phillips 66 today released a letter from Independent Director Bob Pease to the Company’s shareholders.
